name: Cookham and Cock Marsh Walk, Maidenhead

ai.summary: An 18 km circular hike starting near Cookham and looping to Cock Marsh and Maidenhead. This strenuous route blends riverbank paths, marshland, hedgerows and rural tracks, rewarding with varied scenery and a true endurance challenge.
ai.terrain_summary: The route uses mixed surfaces: firm riverbank and bridleway paths, grassy field edges, and muddy sections through marshland. Expect stiles, gates, and occasional narrow paths; footing can be uneven and wet after rain, with wetter patches near the marsh.
ai.safety_notes: Allow 4–6 hours for the hike. Check weather and flood risk, especially around Cock Marsh. Wear sturdy waterproof boots, bring layers, and carry plenty of water and snacks. Stay on marked paths, use a map or GPS, tell someone your planned route and return time, and be cautious of livestock and cyclists on shared routes.
recommended_gear: Whistle and mobile phone with charger
Weatherproof outer layer and sun protection
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn (roughly March–May and September–November) are ideal for this walk, with milder temperatures and pleasant scenery. It can be attempted in winter with waterproof gear and extra time, while summer may be hotter and muddier.

seo.title: Cookham and Cock Marsh Walk – 18 km Hard Circular Route near Maidenhead, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover an 18 km challenging circular hike from Cookham to Cock Marsh near Maidenhead. Learn terrain, safety tips, and gear for this marshland countryside walk in the UK.
